titleInfo.title: Interior Anthropoid Coffins of Priest Ankhefenkhonsu, Decorated with Deities Nut and Osiris

mods.abstract: Interior of Anthropois coffins of Priest Ankhenfenkhonsu (Late Period Dynasty XXV), decorated with deities Nut and Osiris at the Gizeh Museum; ornately painted coffins depicting the god Osiris in mummy form with two uraei, holding crook and flail, and wearing a headdress (left) and Nut, goddess of the sky (right) both painted amongst rows of hieroglyphs; imaged against plain background; untitled print.

titleInfo.title: Nineteenth and Early Twentieth Century Images of Egypt

location.physicalLocation: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture

recordInfo.recordContentSource: Frank H. McClung Museum of Natural History and Culture
